content: will now begin working gusset decreases every other round round 1 k to 3 sts before start of instep k2tog k1 knit across instep k1 ssk k to bor 2 sts decreased round 2 k around to bor repeat gusset rounds 1 and 2 until you have 28 32 36 sole sts 56 64 72 sts note some may wish to have patterning across the gusset if this is the case you can knit the first textured chart across your instep row 4 23 on the leg chart for your size and stocking stitch on the sole your gusset should now be complete and you should have a total of 56 64 72 sts this is the end of clue 3 copyright robin e johnston 2025 9 heritage surprise you have completed the cuff leg and gusset of your sock now for the foot foot continue with your foot with the chart for your size found on pages 11 12 13 please note the foot sizes were taken from kate atherly s custom socks chart of course this may not match your foot size nor may your row gauge match that given in this pattern if all the stars align your chart should be centred on your foot and end just where you would start your toe if not you have a choice you can hit the easy button and just knit the foot chart and either continue working the chart while simultaneously working the toe or if you finished your chart and need more length continue in stocking stitch until the foot measures approximately 1 75 2 2 25 / 4 5 5 5 75 cm less than the total desired length reminder total length should be approximately 10% shorter than the foot that will wear it alternatively you can do some maths and see how many rounds of stockinette you might do before and after the chart and before reaching the foot length for a gauge of 12 row per inch/ 2 5cm the chart heights are as follows 2 6 3 6 / 6 5 7 5 15 cm calculate your own row gauge and foot length and see where the chart fits within it remember the foot should measure approximately 1 75 2 2 25 / 4 5 5 5 75 cm less than the total desired length reminder total length should be approximately 10% shorter than the foot that will wear it toe move bor marker to the start of instep round 1 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before end of instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before bor k2tog k1 4 sts decreased round 2 knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have 36 44 48 sts on your needles repeat round 1 until you have 20 24 28 sts on your needles arrange your stitches so that the first 10 12 14 sts are on one needle and the last 10 12 14 sts are on another needle
